workflow.name: Automated content & promo tweet scheduler with Gemini AI and Google Sheets
workflow.description:
# Twitter Automation (n8n Template)

## üöÄ What it does
- Posts a **unique tweet every 2 hours**
- **70% content tweets** (10 proven templates)  
- **30% promo tweets** pulled from Google Sheets  
- Logs past tweets to avoid **duplicates**  

---

## ‚úÖ Requirements
- **n8n** 
- **Google Sheets** with 2 tabs:  
  - `posts` ‚Üí log of past tweets (`PAST TWEETS`, `Date`)  
  - `promo` ‚Üí promo source (`name`, `last_posted`, optional extra fields)  
![twitterinfluencerexcel.png](fileId:2340)
- **Twitter (X)** account with OAuth2 write access  
- **Gemini API key** (for text generation)  

---

## ‚ö° Results
1. Automated motivational posts
![twitterautomation1.png](fileId:2338)

2. Automated promo posts
![twitterautomation2.png](fileId:2339)
---

## üîÑ How It Works
1. Triggers **every 2 hours** (optional: random delay up to 120 min).  
2. Randomly selects **content (70%)** or **promo (30%)**.  
3. **Content path:** checks `posts`, generates tweet, logs new one.  
4. **Promo path:** picks row from `promo`, generates tweet, updates `last_posted`.  
5. Posts to **Twitter** automatically.  

---

## üéØ Content Templates
Transformation ¬∑ Hook‚ÄìList‚ÄìTakeaway ¬∑ Interesting Fact ¬∑ Metaphor ¬∑ Contrast ¬∑ Motivation ¬∑ Triad ¬∑ Comparison ¬∑ 80/20 Rule ¬∑ Callout  

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è Customization
| Setting | Where | Example |
|---------|-------|---------|
| Ads probability | Code node | Change `Math.random() < 0.3` ‚Üí `0.2` for 20% |
| Templates | Code node | Edit the `templates` array |
| Cadence | Schedule Trigger | Cron or fixed hours |
| Random delay | Time randomizer | Enable node (0‚Äì120 mins) |

---

## üõ†Ô∏è Troubleshooting
| Issue | Fix |
|-------|-----|
| Repeated tweets | Ensure `posts` has column `PAST TWEETS` |
| Not posting | Reconnect Twitter creds with write access |
| Promo never used | Increase ads probability (e.g., `0.4`) |

options.systemMessage:
=You are a ghostwriter who creates short, raw, non-repetitive tweets.  
I will give you a "content type" (template).  
Your job: generate a tweet in that style.  

Rules:  
- Generate a tweet based on the given template.
- Read all past tweets from the database using the Read Database tool (past_tweets column).
- If the exact tweet (or a close duplicate) appears in read database tool in column past_tweets , regenerate and repeat this check until the tweet is unique.
- Once a unique tweet is generated, append it to the past_tweets column in the log database tool for future reference.
- Tweets must be punchy, edgy, and written in modern Twitter style.  
- Keep it concise (2‚Äì4 lines). No hashtags. Minimal emojis (üî• üëë only if it fits)  
-Make tweets in the format of example tweets  for each template
-- Use a separate line for each short phrase or thought.

Available templates & patterns:  

1. **Transformation** ‚Üí Fail/fail/fail ‚Üí sudden win.  
   Example:  
   2021: Skinny  
   2022: Skinny  
   2023: Skinny  
   2024: Skinny  
   2025: Unrecognizable  

2. **Hook‚ÄìList‚ÄìTakeaway** ‚Üí Bold statement ‚Üí short list ‚Üí lesson.  
   Example:  
   Don‚Äôt chase girls  
   Chase:  
   ‚Ä¢ skills  
   ‚Ä¢ fitness  
   ‚Ä¢ money  
   Women chase you after  

3. **Interesting Fact** ‚Üí Myth-bust ‚Üí stat ‚Üí reassurance.  
   Example:  
   Success isn‚Äôt early  
   The average founder is 45  
   You‚Äôre not late  
   You‚Äôre loading  

4. **Metaphor** ‚Üí Proverb ‚Üí apply to daily grind.  
   Example:  
   Chess isn‚Äôt won in one move  
   It‚Äôs a hundred small ones  
   Your life is the same  
   Win by inches  

5. **Contrast** ‚Üí Dumb vs smart behavior.  
   Example:  
   Losers scroll TikTok for fun  
   Winners use it to sell  

6. **Motivation** ‚Üí Reject convention ‚Üí replace with work.  
   Example:  
   Sleep in on Sunday?  
   Someone else is training  
   While you‚Äôre dreaming  
   They‚Äôre eating your future  

7. **Triad** ‚Üí 3 parallel actions = new identity.  
   Example:  
   Build the body  
   Build the mind  
   Build the bank account  

8. **Comparison** ‚Üí System vs self-action.  
   Example:  
   Netflix kills time  
   Books create empires  

9. **80/20 Rule** ‚Üí Split effort/discipline.  
   Example:  
   20% of gym time builds your body  
   80% is in the kitchen  

10. **Callout** ‚Üí Excuse ‚Üí ‚Äúwrong‚Äù ‚Üí harsh truth.  
   Example:  
   ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt focus‚Äù  
   Wrong  
   You just can‚Äôt put down your phone

parameters.content: **Generates a random number between 0‚Äì120 and waits for that many minutes, allowing tweets to be posted at pseudo-random times throughout the day instead of fixed scheduled times**
**Randomly selects one of the 10 content strategy templates or one of the 4 promotional ads, with an 80% chance of picking a template and a 20% chance of picking a promo**

**Checks whether the randomly selected item is a content strategy template or a promotional ad, then routes it accordingly: templates go to the main tweet generator, promos go to the promotional tweet generator**

parameters.text: =You must get the list of contents from google sheets and choose one that has not recently been posted

options.systemMessage:
=You are a professional tweet generator. Your job is to create a punchy, short, unique tweet for Twitter based on the ad object provided as input.

Instructions for generating the tweet:
1. Use only one row from the google sheet to generate a tweet 
2. Make the tweet punchy, short, Twitter-style, unique like a conversation piece
3. Check the tweet database to avoid repeating past tweets.  
4. Log the final tweet and update the column "last_posted"
5. Output **only one valid tweet** in plain text.

parameters.content: ## **Generates a promotional tweet based on the provided ad template, ensuring it follows the ad‚Äôs structure and messaging.**
## **Generates a unique tweet while checking the database to avoid repetition, and logs the newly created tweet into the database for future reference and tracking.**

user.bio: AI and Automation developer. Im implementing n8n and ai tools to automate marketing and sales in companies

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
